arts.ttl: Revealed: The real reason behind Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's surprise trip to Molineux as ex-Manchester United boss is linked to Wolves job with pressure growing on Gary O'Neil amid chaotic scenes after Ipswich defeat
arts.sum: Solskjaer was back in the Premier League on Saturday - albeit only as a spectator. The former striker has not had a job in management since he was sacked by United more than three years ago.

arts.ttl: Conceding, cracks and fighting - are Wolves 'falling apart'?
arts.sum: Match of the Day's Gary Lineker, Theo Walcott and Ashley Williams look at the conceded goals and ugly scenes from Wolverhampton Wanderers during their 2-1 defeat by Ipswich as the club battles against relegation.

arts.ttl: Wolves striker Matheus Cunha could face FA ban after ugly scenes following Ipswich loss
arts.sum: Ipswich Town beat Wolves in dramatic fashion in the Premier League on Saturday afternoon and after tempers flared following the final whistle, an investigation could be launched

arts.ttl: Frustration, anger & fighting - Wolves' unity falling apart
arts.sum: The unity Gary O'Neil quickly built at Wolves is in danger of falling apart after tempers frayed again following their defeat by Ipswich.

arts.ttl: O'Neil fights on: Wolves players need me - but I can't fix certain errors
arts.sum: Gary O'Neil insisted Wolves' players need him after their 2-1 home defeat to fellow strugglers Ipswich that left the boss under serious pressure.

arts.ttl: I’ll keep fighting for them until I’m told not to – Wolves boss Gary O’Neil
arts.sum: Jack Taylor’s stoppage-time goal condemned Wolves to a 2-1 home defeat to Ipswich.

arts.ttl: 'I have never had such a struggle' - O'Neil says Wolves failing to get 'basics' right
arts.sum: Wolves boss Gary O'Neil says he has "never had such a struggle" to coach a group of players at Premier League level, after a disappointing loss against Ipswich at Molineux Stadium.

arts.ttl: Wolves man ‘does not lose sight’ of former club – Social media activity seen as potential transfer hints
arts.sum: Wolverhampton Wanderers forward Pablo Sarabia may be inadvertently fuelling transfer speculation by his continued efforts to remember Sevilla and his time there. That’s at least if Estadio Deportivo’s latest report is anything to go by, as they insist the player ‘does not lose sight’ of his former team. The newspaper reports that Sarabia remains ‘attentive The post Wolves man ‘does not lose sight’ of former club – Social media activity seen as potential transfer hints appeared first on Sport Witness.

arts.ttl: 'Brilliant moment' - McKenna praises Ipswich after late win against Wolves
arts.sum: Ipswich manager Kieran McKenna says it's a "brilliant moment" for the club after a 94th-minute goal by Jack Taylor gave The Tractor Boys a 2-1 win against Wolves at Molineux Stadium.

arts.ttl: Sources: Why Ole Gunnar Solskjaer was at Wolves as Ipswich loss leaves Gary O'Neil on brink
arts.sum: The former Man United boss was spotted in the stands...
